revised_title: Luminescence of Mercury Vapour and Transfer of Nitrogen Excitation
tldr: The author investigates the luminescence of mercury vapour when exposed to a-ray irradiation in the presence of nitrogen. They observe a green glow that intensifies with increased pressure and temperature. The author also explores the similarities between this luminescence and the "wing effect" in fluorescence of optically excited mercury, suggesting a connection between the two phenomena.
